intro: Ricinocarpus fasciculatus, commonly known as the clustered ricin tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its clustered growth habit and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by woody, spiny fruits. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
